elements.title: a 13th-century wooden sculpture (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a 13th-century wooden sculpture (pictured) of the bodhisattva Rāgarāja was carved from the debris of the Great Buddha Hall at Tōdai-ji in Nara, Japan?

elements.title: Habib Mousa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Habib Mousa wrote a song about the village of Enhil to object to the Turkification of Assyrian villages in Tur Abdin?

elements.title: 1702 siege of Liège (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the leading engineer during the 1702 siege of Liège was so angered by a colleague's disobedience that he threatened to abandon the siege?

elements.title: Antirrhinum barrelieri (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Antirrhinum barrelieri was split into two species in 1896, the other being Antirrhinum controversum?

elements.title: Soebekti Soenarto (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Soebekti Soenarto performed the duties of the governor, vice governor, and provincial secretary of the Special Region of Yogyakarta simultaneously for several weeks in 1998?

elements.title: Bukit Gombak (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the roof designs of Bukit Gombak and Bukit Batok stations were based on the logo of the Singapore Housing and Development Board?

elements.title: Rory Gibson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that actor Rory Gibson was cast on The Young and the Restless despite the producers not liking his initial self-tape?

elements.title: A Far Better Thing (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that A Far Better Thing is a retelling of Charles Dickens's A Tale of Two Cities with fairy changelings?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

San Carlos de Bariloche

The Argentine adventure capital offers great opportunities for skiing, sightseeing, water sports, trekking and climbing amidst the amazing mountainous landscapes of Argentine Patagonia.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Sekigahara

This quaint mountain town and battlefield, where Tokugawa won control of Japan, gives visitors firsthand insight into feudal Japanese warfare.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

Driving in China

China isn't one of the countries that foreigners commonly explore by driving themselves. If you'd still like to, the first step would be getting a local driving licence.
